author: Harry Craddock
description: My recipe remains pretty true to Craddock's classic 1930's proportions but, in line with modern bartending conventions, I now disregard Craddock's instructions and stir rather than shake this cocktail. However, arguably, shaking yields an even more delicious drink and, if you decide to shake, consider doubling the measures of both crème de violette and absinthe. Shaken, or stirred, this Martini-style cocktail is dry and aromatic with subtle floral and aniseed notes.
name: The Atty Cocktail

recipeInstructions.text: STIR all ingredients with ice and strain into chilled glass
